verses.verse: When you sit<WH3427> to eat<WH3898> with a ruler,<WH4910> consider<WH995> diligently<WH995> what is before you;<WH6440>
put<WH7760> a knife<WH7915> to your throat,<WH3930> if you are a man given<WH1167> to appetite.<WH5315>
Don't<WH183> be desirous of his dainties,<WH4303> since they are deceitful<WH3577> food.<WH3899>
Don't<WH3021> weary yourself to be rich.<WH6238> In your wisdom,<WH998> show restraint.<WH2308>
Why do you set<WH5774> your eyes<WH5869> on that which is not?<WH6213> For it certainly sprouts<WH6213> wings<WH3671> like an eagle<WH5404> and flies<WH5774> in the sky.<WH8064>
Don't<WH3898> eat the food<WH3899> of him who has a stingy<WH7451> eye,<WH5869> and don't<WH183> crave his delicacies:<WH4303>
for as he thinks<WH8176> about<WH5315> the cost,<WH398> so he is. "Eat and drink!<WH8354>" he says<WH559> to you,<WH3820> but his heart is not with you.
The morsel<WH6595> which you have eaten<WH398> you shall vomit up,<WH6958> and lose<WH7843> your good<WH5273> words.<WH1697>
Don't<WH1696> speak in the ears<WH241> of a fool,<WH3684> for he will despise<WH936> the wisdom<WH7922> of your words.<WH4405>
Don't<WH5253> move the ancient<WH5769> boundary stone.<WH1366> Don't<WH935> encroach on the fields<WH7704> of the fatherless:<WH3490>
for their Defender<WH1350> is strong.<WH2389> He will plead<WH7378> their case against you.<WH7379>
Apply<WH935> your heart<WH3820> to instruction,<WH4148> and your ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of knowledge.<WH1847>
Don't<WH4513> withhold correction<WH4148> from a child.<WH5288> If you punish<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> he will not die.<WH4191>
Punish<WH5221> him with the rod,<WH7626> and save<WH5337> his soul<WH5315> from Sheol.<WH7585>
My son,<WH1121> if your heart<WH3820> is wise,<WH2449> then my heart<WH3820> will be glad,<WH8055> even mine:<WH589>
yes,<WH3629> my heart will rejoice,<WH5937> when your lips<WH8193> speak<WH1696> what is right.<WH4339>
Don't<WH3820> let your heart envy<WH7065> sinners;<WH2400> but rather fear<WH3374> Yahweh<WH3068> all the day long.<WH3117>
Indeed surely there is<WH3426> a future<WH319> hope,<WH8615> and your hope will not be cut off.<WH3772>
Listen,<WH8085> my son,<WH1121> and be wise,<WH2449> and keep<WH833> your heart<WH3820> on the right path!<WH1870>
Don't<WH3196> be among ones drinking too much wine,<WH2151> or those who gorge themselves on meat:<WH1320>
for the drunkard<WH5433> and the glutton<WH2151> shall become poor;<WH3423> and drowsiness<WH5124> clothes<WH3847> them in rags.<WH7168>
Listen<WH8085> to your father<WH1> who gave you life,<WH3205> and don't<WH936> despise your mother<WH517> when she is old.<WH2204>
Buy<WH7069> the truth,<WH571> and don't<WH4376> sell it.<WH2451> Get wisdom, discipline,<WH4148> and understanding.<WH998>
The father<WH1> of the righteous<WH6662> has great<WH1524> joy.<WH1523> Whoever fathers<WH3205> a wise<WH2450> child delights in him.<WH8055>
Let your father<WH1> and your mother<WH517> be glad!<WH8055> Let her who bore<WH3205> you rejoice!<WH1523>
My son,<WH1121> give<WH5414> me your heart;<WH3820> and let your eyes<WH5869> keep<WH7521> in my ways.<WH1870>
For a prostitute<WH2181> is a deep<WH6013> pit;<WH7745> and a wayward wife<WH5237> is a narrow<WH6862> well.<WH875>
Yes,<WH693> she lies in wait like a robber,<WH2863> and increases<WH3254> the unfaithful<WH898> among men.<WH120>
Who has woe?<WH188> Who has sorrow?<WH17> Who has strife?<WH4079> Who has complaints?<WH7879> Who has needless<WH2600> bruises?<WH6482> Who has bloodshot<WH2448> eyes?<WH5869>
Those who stay long<WH309> at the wine;<WH3196> those who go<WH935> to seek<WH2713> out mixed wine.<WH4469>
Don't<WH7200> look at the wine<WH3196> when it is red,<WH119> when it<WH5414> sparkles<WH5869> in the cup,<WH3563> when it goes<WH1980> down smoothly.<WH4339>
In the end,<WH319> it bites<WH5391> like a snake,<WH5175> and poisons<WH6567> like a viper.<WH6848>
Your eyes<WH5869> will see<WH7200> strange things,<WH2114> and your mind<WH3820> will imagine<WH1696> confusing things.<WH8419>
Yes,<WH7901> you will be as he who lies down in the midst<WH3820> of the sea,<WH3220> or as he who lies<WH7901> on top<WH7218> of the rigging:<WH2260>
"They hit<WH5221> me,<WH2470> and I was not hurt! They beat<WH1986> me,<WH3045> and I don't feel it!<WH6974> When will I wake up?<WH1245> I can do it again. I can find another.<WH3254>"
